page.title: 14A Housewife's Day
page.content: My day begins at 6.30 when I am awakened by the clock radio. I don't rise at this unearthly hour but lie dozing until 7.30. After a frantic rush and last minute shouts of "Have you cleaned your teeth and have you got your spelling book, Elizabeth?" the children arrive at school by 9.00. It's my day for school too. I help with the infants which I enjoy greatly. It's more interesting than housework. When I get home at midday I have a cup of coffee and turn on the radio. Then I tackle Sophie's bedroom. This takes courage as she is very creative. The children play after school until suppertime. Once they have gone to bed, I have time to watch the television or read before having my bath and falling into bed about 11p.m.
